channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The Comstock Act: Trump’s Allies Say They’ll Enforce It
item.description: Democrats should rally around a bill to overhaul the 1873 anti-vice law.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Strike on Area Where Displaced Gazans Were Camped Kills Up to 25
item.description: The strike in Al-Mawasi damaged the offices and residences of the International Committee of the Red Cross, the group said. The Israeli military said it was looking into the incident.

item.title: Elite matchmakers—with fees up to $300K—are coaching clients on how to navigate the dating world: It gets tricky for women over 40, experts say
item.description: Matchmakers can help clients avoid the time sink of funneling online or app-based profiles into possible dates.

item.title: Florida to Pay Millions to Victims of Abuses at Notorious Reform School
item.description: A $20 million program will give financial restitution to students who endured abuse and neglect at the hands of the state.

item.title: UN Chief Warns Israel and Hezbollah of the Risk of a Wider War
item.description: “The people of the region and the people of the world cannot afford Lebanon to become another Gaza,” he said.

item.title: FDA OKs first menthol e-cigarettes, drawing criticism from parent groups who say the agency has ‘failed American families’
item.description: The FDA authorized four menthol e-cigarettes from NJOY, the vaping brand recently acquired by tobacco giant Altria, which also makes Marlboro cigarettes.

item.title: Arkansas Grocery Store Shooting Leaves 3 Dead and 10 Injured
item.description: Two police officers were injured in the attack at the Mad Butcher store in Fordyce, and the shooter was injured, the authorities said.

item.title: Gilead Shot Provides Total Protection From HIV in Trial of Young African Women
item.description: An injection given just twice a year could herald a breakthrough in protecting the population that has the highest infection rates.

item.title: Nvidia dethroned as world’s most valuable company after just a few days on top as $220 billion selloff sends it to third place
item.description: Nvidia’s market cap was about $3.1 trillion on Friday, lower than Apple Inc. at $3.2 trillion and Microsoft Corp. at $3.3 trillion.

item.title: The Culture Wars Came to a California Suburb. A Leader Has Been Ousted.
item.description: Voters recalled a Southern California school board president after his conservative majority approved policies on critical race theory and transgender issues.

item.title: Hundreds of Hajj Pilgrims Reported Dead Amid Extreme Heat
item.description: Searing heat in Saudi Arabia appeared to at least contribute to many of the deaths.

item.title: How do you pronounce ‘Nvidia’? Here’s how to say the $3 trillion company’s name, which has mythological roots
item.description: The first “Nvidia” was Invidia, the Roman goddess of envy.

item.title: Man Who Attacked Nancy Pelosi’s Husband Is Convicted in California Trial
item.description: In 2022, David DePape broke into Ms. Pelosi’s San Francisco home and eventually beat her husband with a hammer.

item.title: Iran’s 2024 Presidential Election: What to Know
item.description: Iran will hold a special election later this month to replace former President Ebrahim Raisi, who died in a helicopter crash in May.

item.title: Malaysia’s China-friendly stance is a bid to get its biggest trading partner to help keep the economy stable: ‘You can’t be choosy’
item.description: China and Malaysia agreed to a dozen new deals during China Premier Li Qiang’s trip to the Southeast Asian country earlier this week.
